example.name: agentive
example.text: [The machinists' criticisms of the labor-management bid and their threats of a strike unless they received substantial wage increases this year]-1 helped *trace*-1 cool banks' interest in financing the transaction.
example.arg: banks' interest in financing the transaction

example.name: ergative
example.text: Paribas plans a bid for another big French financial and industrial firm, Navigation Mixte, a sign Europe's takeover fever hasn't cooled.

predicate.note: Frames file for 'cool' based on sentences in financial subcorpus andautomatic expansion via verbnet.

example.name: usually in ergative?
example.text: ``Options traders, arbitrage traders -- everyone,'' said [Mr. Bates]-1, *trace*-1 cooling down with a carton of apple juice after the close yesterday.
example.arg: with a carton of apple juice

example.name: wierd usage with start point
example.text: Trading activity cooled off from Monday's sizzling pace.

frameset.note: In theory all of these could take start and end points and EXT, but itseems very rare and even a little weird, to me.
